[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: hkzg_chunked_elgamal] [Type: Homomorphism] [Tuple composition] Does the tuple homomorphism properly bind HKZG and ElGamal proofs, or can an attacker mix witnesses from different transcripts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: hkzg_chunked_elgamal] [Function: new()] [Projection safety] Do the projection functions properly extract the right fields from HkzgElgamalWitness, or can field ordering bugs cause incorrect proof generation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: hkzg_chunked_elgamal] [Function: new()] [Zero prepending] Why is a zero prepended to chunked_plaintexts in the HKZG projection, and can removing it break soundness? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: hkzg_chunked_elgamal] [Function: generate()] [Random proof] Does the random proof generation for testing produce plausible-looking but invalid proofs that could accidentally be accepted? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: hkzg_chunked_elgamal] [Type: LiftedHkzg] [Lifting soundness] Does lifting the HKZG homomorphism preserve all security properties, or can the projection introduce vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: hkzg_chunked_elgamal] [Type: LiftedChunkedElgamal] [Projection correctness] Is ignoring hkzg_randomness in the ChunkedElgamal projection safe, or can this leak information? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: keys] [Struct: EncryptPubKey] [Key validation] Does EncryptPubKey validate that ek is a valid point on the curve and not point at infinity during deserialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: keys] [Struct: EncryptPubKey] [Subgroup check] Is ek checked to be in the prime-order subgroup, or can small-subgroup attacks compromise encryption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: keys] [Function: to_bytes()] [Serialization] Does serialization use compression correctly to prevent malleability in key representation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: keys] [Function: try_from()] [Deserialization] Can deserialize_compressed accept invalid encodings that later cause cryptographic failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: keys] [Struct: DecryptPrivKey] [Key generation] Does generate() produce uniformly random decryption keys, or can bias lead to predictable keys? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: keys] [Struct: DecryptPrivKey] [Zero key] Can dk be zero, and if so, does this break the encryption scheme completely? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: keys] [Function: to() for DecryptPrivKey] [Key derivation] Does computing ek = H^dk properly derive the encryption key, or can rogue key attacks occur? (High)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: keys] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Group validation] Is the G element validated to be in G2, or can cross-group attacks occur? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: keys] [Type aliases] [Type safety] Do DealtSecretKey and DealtSecretKeyShare being simple type aliases provide sufficient type safety, or can they be confused? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: public_parameters] [Function: new()] [Setup trust] Does the trusted setup for DeKART range proof require a powers of tau ceremony, and can toxic waste compromise security? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: public_parameters] [Function: new()] [Max chunks overflow] Can max_num_chunks_padded overflow when computing (max_num_shares * num_chunks + 1).next_power_of_two() - 1? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: public_parameters] [Function: new()] [Generator reuse] Is using GroupGenerators::default() safe, or should generators be DKG-specific to prevent cross-protocol attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: public_parameters] [Function: new()] [G_2 generation] Does hashing 'G_2' with DST produce a uniformly random G2 element, or can attackers find collisions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: public_parameters] [Function: new()] [BSGS table] Can the BSGS table building fail or produce incorrect tables for certain ell values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: public_parameters] [Function: compute_powers_of_radix()] [Power overflow] Can computing powers of 2^ell cause field element overflow for large ell? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: public_parameters] [Struct: PublicParameters] [Deserialization] Does custom deserialize properly rebuild table and powers_of_radix, or can they be out of sync with pp_elgamal? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: public_parameters] [Struct: PublicParameters] [Ell validation] Is ell validated to be in acceptable range (e.g., 8, 16, 32, 64) or can arbitrary values break chunking? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: public_parameters] [Function: default()] [Testing parameters] Does using DEFAULT_ELL_FOR_TESTING=16 in production deployments weaken security? (Medium)
